description: Construction of four storey residential building to create four self-contained units (two, two bedroom flats and two, one bedroom flats) following demolition of part of existing building.
decision_conditions: The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 006; 007 Rev B; 008 Rev C; 009 Rev C; 010 Rev A; 015 Rev B; 016 Rev C; 017 Rev B; 018 Rev B; 020 Rev B; Design and Access Statement, produced by Hunter Price Chartered Architects; Sustainable Design and Construction and Renewable Energy Statement, dated December 2012; Daylight and Sunlight Assessment, dated December 2012, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority (legal agreement) and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the third floor flat shall obtain a resident's parking permit (including visitors' permits) within any controlled parking zone which may be in force in the area at any time. The professional and legal fees incurred by the Council in drafting and completing the agreement shall be met by the applicant/owner.  Reason: To ensure that the development is car-free and does not exacerbate on-street parking pressure in the local controlled parking zone in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 6.13 of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policies 6.13 of the London Plan 2011. | The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Prior to commencement of the development, details and/or samples of materials to be used in the external surfaces of the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details approved, maintained as such thereafter.  Reason:  To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and to ensure that the resulting appearance and construction of the development is of a high standard, in accordance with policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7.4 of the London Plan, policies 1.1, 1.2(f) and 1.2(g) of the Local Development (Core) Strategy 2012, Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Plan Document, policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 2004: Plan for the and Supplementary Planning Document 4: Residential Extensions. | Details of attenuation measures from external noise and vibration together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential dwelling hereby permitted shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.  The details approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the dwelling and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policy 5.3 of the London Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Adopted Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 (Noise and Vibration). | Cycle storage for four cycles in accordance with adopted standards shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential units hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter.  Reason:  To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policy 9.6 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Core Strategy and policy 6.9 of the London Plan 2011. | Refuse and recycling storage enclosures shall be provided prior to first occupation of the residential unit hereby approved and retained permanently thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), emerging policy 7B of the Draft Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and The London Plan (July 2011) policy 5.16. | The proposed windows in the west elevation of the building hereby approved shall be obscure glazed and fixed shut below a height of 1.7m above the finished internal floor level.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004).
